defs.docs: # elasticlunr-rs

attributes.value: / A partial port of [elasticlunr](https://github.com/weixsong/elasticlunr.js) to Rust. Intended to
/ be used for generating compatible search indices.
/ Access to all index-generating functionality is provided. Most users will only need to use the
/ index.add_doc("1", &["This is a title", "This is body text!"]);

defs.name: ELASTICLUNR_VERSION
defs.docs: The version of elasticlunr.js this library was designed for.

attributes.value: / The version of elasticlunr.js this library was designed for.

defs.name: config
defs.docs:
These types are not used for generating `Index`es. They are provided to help with
 creating compatible JSON structures for configuring the JavaScript search
 function.

attributes.value: / These types are not used for generating `Index`es. They are provided to help with
/ creating compatible JSON structures for configuring the JavaScript search

defs.name: SearchOptionsField
defs.docs:
Used to set the search configuration for a specific field.
 When `expand` or `bool` is `None`, elasticlunr.js will use the value from
 the global configuration. The `boost` field, if present,
 increases the importance of this field when ordering search results.

attributes.value: / Used to set the search configuration for a specific field.
/ When `expand` or `bool` is `None`, elasticlunr.js will use the value from
/ the global configuration. The `boost` field, if present,
/ increases the importance of this field when ordering search results.

defs.name: SearchBool
defs.docs:
Sets which boolean model is used for searching with
 multiple terms. Defaults to `Or`.

attributes.value: / Sets which boolean model is used for searching with
/ - *AND* requires every search term to be present in results
/ - *OR* accepts results which have at least one term

defs.name: SearchOptions
defs.docs:
The search configuration map which is passed to the
 elasticlunr.js `Index.search()` function.

attributes.value: / The search configuration map which is passed to the

defs.name: document_store
defs.docs: Implements an elasticlunr.js document store. Most users do not need to use this module directly.

attributes.value: / Implements an elasticlunr.js document store. Most users do not need to use this module directly.

defs.name: DocumentStore
defs.docs:
The document store saves the complete text of each item saved to the index, if enabled.
 Most users do not need to use this type directly.

attributes.value: / The document store saves the complete text of each item saved to the index, if enabled.
/ Most users do not need to use this type directly.

defs.name: lang
defs.docs:
Intended to be compatible with <https://github.com/MihaiValentin/lunr-languages>. Each supported
 language has a trimmer, a stop word filter, and a stemmer. Most users will not need to use
 these modules directly.

attributes.value: / Intended to be compatible with <https://github.com/MihaiValentin/lunr-languages>. Each supported
/ language has a trimmer, a stop word filter, and a stemmer. Most users will not need to use

defs.name: Language
defs.docs: Used to configure the `Index` for a specific lanugage.

attributes.value: / Used to configure the `Index` for a specific lanugage.

defs.name: from_code
defs.docs:
Returns the `Language` for the given two-character [ISO 639-1][iso] language code if the
 language is supported. Returns `None` if not supported.

attributes.value: / Returns the `Language` for the given two-character [ISO 639-1][iso] language code if the
/ language is supported. Returns `None` if not supported.
/ The ISO 639-1 code for Dutch is "nl". However "du" is used for the module name
/ and pipeline suffix in order to match lunr-languages.

defs.name: to_code
defs.docs: Returns the two-character [ISO 639-1][iso] language code for the `Language`.

attributes.value: / Returns the two-character [ISO 639-1][iso] language code for the `Language`.
/ The ISO 639-1 code for Dutch is "nl". However "du" is used for the module name
/ and pipeline suffix in order to match lunr-languages.

defs.name: make_pipeline
defs.docs: Creates a pipeline for the [`Language`](../lang/enum.Language.html).

defs.name: pipeline
defs.docs:
Defines the pipeline which processes text for inclusion in the index. Most users do not need
 to use this module directly.

defs.docs: A sequence of `PipelineFn`s which are run on tokens to prepare them for searching.

defs.docs: Returns a pipeline for the given [`Language`](../lang/enum.Language.html).

defs.name: run
defs.docs:
Run the Pipeline against the given vector of tokens. The returned vector may be shorter
 than the input if a pipeline function returns `None` for a token.

attributes.value: / Run the Pipeline against the given vector of tokens. The returned vector may be shorter
/ than the input if a pipeline function returns `None` for a token.

defs.name: new
defs.value: pub fn new<I>(I) -> Self where I: IntoIterator, I::Item: AsRef<str>
defs.docs: Create a new index with the provided fields.

attributes.value: / Create a new index with the provided fields.
/ index.add_doc("1", &["How to Foo", "First, you need to `bar`.", "Chapter 1 > How to Foo"]);
/ Panics if multiple given fields are identical.

I::Item: AsRef<str>

Create a new index with the provided fields for the given
 [`Language`](lang/enum.Language.html).

attributes.value: / Create a new index with the provided fields for the given
/ index.add_doc("1", &["this is a title", "this is body text"]);
/ Panics if multiple given fields are identical.

defs.name: add_doc
defs.value:
pub fn add_doc<I>(&mut Self, &str, I) where I: IntoIterator,
I::Item: AsRef<str>
defs.docs: Add the data from a document to the index.

attributes.value: / Add the data from a document to the index.
/ *NOTE: The elements of `data` should be provided in the same order as
/ the fields used to create the index.*
/ index.add_doc("1", &["this is a title", "this is body text"]);

defs.name: add_doc_with_tokenizer
defs.value:
pub fn add_doc_with_tokenizer<I>(&mut Self, &str, I, TokenizerFn) where
I: IntoIterator, I::Item: AsRef<str>
defs.docs: Add the data from a document to the index.

attributes.value: / Add the data from a document to the index.
/ *NOTE: The elements of `data` should be provided in the same order as
/ the fields used to create the index.*
/ index.add_doc_with_tokenizer("1", &["this is a title", "this is body text"], css_tokenizer);

defs.name: add_doc_with_tokenizers
defs.value:
pub fn add_doc_with_tokenizers<I, T>(&mut Self, &str, I, T) where
I: IntoIterator, I::Item: AsRef<str>, T: IntoIterator<Item = TokenizerFn>
defs.docs: Add the data from a document to the index.

attributes.value: / Add the data from a document to the index.
/ *NOTE: The elements of `data` and `tokenizers` should be provided in
/ the same order as the fields used to create the index.*
/ index.add_doc_with_tokenizers("1", &["this is a title", "this is body text"], tokenizers);
